item.description:
The Hygienic Art XXXII Salon des Independents
Lets meet at 7:45 pm

NO judge,NO jury, NO fees, No censors!
I invite all our Artist friends to join in. Or just come for the reception - AT 8, sublime and outrageous, a night Art, Film, Music, Poetry, and much more.

Hygienic Art XXXII Salon des Independents will open on January 29 at 8pm at the Hygienic Art Galleries at 79 Bank Street in Downtown New London. Sign-in and hanging begins that day at 8am and runs to 6pm. The show is open to all artists, everyone is welcome. The exhibition is well-known for its diverse original art ranging from the sublime to the outrageous. We hope you'll join us by submitting a piece!
There's plenty to do in town all day long leading up to the art show including the Garde's Take the Stage variety show, the Young Artists Show, The Rock Fix, The Screening Room and much much more - and that's all just the first weekend!

See you at Hygienic!

and more!!!!.......
The Screening Room is New London’s premier free Independent Film Festival featuring works from both emerging and established filmmakers. As with the art show itself, there will be no judge, no jury, no entry fee and no censorship!
Whether you are a student, at-home video visionary or working professional, this is the venue for any independent filmmaker to have their work seen.
Every year brings new creative visions – ranging from regional shorts and animations to feature length films. Premiere day may be full of surprises – so don’t miss it!
Admission to all screenings is free. Donations accepted.

Fire & Ice 8pm to 9pm – Hygienic Art Park
Fire performers will dazzle you with their skill and grace as their flames are reflected in surrounding ice sculptures.

The Hygienic Cabaret- 8pm-2pm @ The Oasis

Hygienic Art & Cosmodemonic Telegraph present:
The ROCK FIX @ The Crocker House Ballroom part of HYGIENIC ART XXXII

7pm Burnouts from Outer Space
7:40 Bedroom Rehab Corporation
8:15 N.M.E. the Illest
8:50 Straight to VHS
9:35 John Fries and the Heat
10:15 Gone for Good
11pm The Hempsteadys
The show is all ages and open to all. Beer and wine available for purchase, a valid ID must be presented.
There will also be an indie marketplace hosted by New London's new record store The Telegraph featuring local releases from New London area bands and artists including the new scene compilation The Long Hundred and the fourth series of CosmoSingles.

http://hygienic.ning....

There is a lot for parking just behind the gallery, turn left on Golden street, lot ahead on left.
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in the front room of the gallery, will wear the BW scarf.
item.name: Salon des Independents
